description: Syllabus for MATH 360-361: a study of the foundations of the differential and integral calculus, including the real numbers and elementary topology, continuous and differentiable functions, uniform convergence of series of functions, and inverse and implicit function theorems. MATH 508-509 is a masters level version of this course.
name: ADVANCED CALCULUS

values.comments:
This course is a study of the foundations of the differential and integral calculus,
including the real numbers and elementary topology, continuous and differentiable
functions, uniform convergence of series of functions, and inverse and implicit function
theorems. MATH 508-509 is a masters level version of this course.
Students described this class as fast moving but very informative. Students
described that after the course they were able to develop their thoughts better as well as
being able to better think logically. Students felt that the assignments were manageable,
but still difficult.
Overall students seemed to enjoy Professor Cooper. He was described as being
able to communicate well and share his love of mathematics. Students wished that he
would post all the answers to his problem sets online as those were very helpful.
While this class was enjoyed by many students, it was also described as difficult.
One student stated that he spent 12-20 hours per week on homework assignments alone
as well as most of his Thanksgiving Break working on problem sets. Regardless,
students said that the work was worth the effort and recommended this class to other
students looking to learn more about higher level mathematics.
